thread.title: Jason Peters, Lane Johnson will try to play as planned for Eagles
thread.title_full: Jason Peters, Lane Johnson will try to play as planned for Eagles

author: Nick Fierro
title: Jason Peters, Lane Johnson will try to play as planned for Eagles
text:
Jason Peters, Lane Johnson will try to play as planned for Eagles Jason Peters Matt Rourke / AP Eagles tackle Jason Peters is following through with his promise to play through a quad injury. Eagles tackle Jason Peters is following through with his promise to play through a quad injury. (Matt Rourke / AP) Nick Fierro Contact Reporter Of The Morning Call #Eagles injured offensive linemen will try to suck it up vs. Saints. 
PHILADELPHIA â€” Tackles Jason Peters and Lane Johnson are going to try playing through their injuries, as both Philadelphia Eagles predicted last week. 
Both have been activated for today's game against the New Orleans Saints, along with outside linebacker Marcus Smith. 
Peters played just six snaps last week before leaving with a quadriceps injury. Johnson has a strained medial collateral ligament. 
Scratched for the Eagles are QB Thad Lewis, RB Kenjon Barner, CB Denzel Rice, LBs Kiki Alonso and Mychal Kendricks, G Julian Vandervelde and defensive end Brandon Bair. 
Inactive for the saints are P Thomas Morstead, QB Garrett Grayson, DEs Obum Gwacham and Bobby Richardson, T Terron Armstead, FB Austin Johnson and G Jahri Evans. 
Evans, a Philadelphia native and former Bloomsburg University star, could be the Saints' best offensive lineman, but he remains out with an injury, along with Morstead, which forced the Saints to sign a second punter, Brandon Fields, two weeks ago.
